page.title: 07HEALTH CARE IN HARROW
page.content: THE PEOPLE OF HARROW ARE CARED FOR UNDER THE NATIONAL HEALTH SERVICE IN THE TWO LARGE HOSPITALS OF MOUNT VERNON AND NORTHWICK PARK.HOWEVER AS IN PRIVATE EDUCATION, HARROW IS IMPORTANT FOR ITS ROLE IN PRIVATE HEALTH CARE.THE HARROW HEALTH CENTRE ON PINNER ROAD IS THE FIRST OF ITS KIND ALLOWING PATIENTS TO CONSULT GENERAL PRACTITIONERS ON A FEE PAYING BASIS AND CLOSE TO HARROW SCHOOL IS THE CLEMENTINE CHURCHILL HOSPITAL ALSO OPERATING WITHIN THE PRIVATE SECTOR.A ROOM THERE COSTS Â£125 PER NIGHT AND WITH OVER 200 STAFF IT IS CONSIDERED TO BE A COMMUNITY HOSPITAL WITH ACUTE CARE FACILITIES.IT PERFORMS MINOR SURGERY BUT ALSO KIDNEY TRANSPLANTS. IT IS ONE OF THE FEW HOSPITALS IN THE COUNTRY TO OWN A VASOSCAN.
